name: TransactionConnection
description: The Connection type for a Transaction

name: TransactionEdge
description:
A single transaction trace response.

WARNING: when doing forward streaming seareches, do NOT forget to include the `undo` field to determine if the message is actually a REVERSAL of the transaction.

NOTE: always check the value of `node.status` to make sure it is successfully executed before assuming it is.

name: Transaction
description:
Traces of the execution of a given transaction. This means the
transaction was executed on the chain. You also get context about the
block in which it was executed, and the status of the execution.

WARN: Make sure to always check the `status` (in the `receipt`) to
make sure you're not considering a failed transaction as if it was
successful.
